title: Ticket #5920: Blocking log event reads with Python bindings can return prematurely
description:
Blocking reads of log events (i.e. read an event with no specified timeout) are broken with the Python bindings, using either the LogReader or EventIterator classes.

For example, with EventIterator.poll, when given a positive timeout argument it seems to work fine. But if timeout is the default value of -1, it returns within a second with no event:

The following code will demonstrate the bug: 

x = htcondor.read_events(open('EventLog'))

for _ in x: pass  # fire through all events so nothing's left

x.poll(4000)  # blocks for 4 seconds as expected

x.poll()  # should block indefinitely but returns after a second

In addition, sub-second LogReader blocking polling on platforms without inotify (mac, windows) is also broken for no good reason.
